column4: I installed Ubuntu about an hour ago and I know next to nothing about it.
Ask more specific questions
link please
What software are you trying to get?
ur on 11.04 right?
Yes, I am using 11.04.
which game?
I'm trying to install FreeCiv and a handful of emulators that I had running under Win7.
so you click 'install this now' and what happenes?
I get an error message saying that there's no software by that name under any of my software sources.
I followed step 1 to "install the playdeb package", and the Software Center says it is installed, but no joy.
step 1 ?
From the link. I clicked on the playdeb link.
give me a link to step 1 please
Okay, I got it to work for FreeCiv 2.3.0. I'm going to try some of the others and see if my problem has been resolved.
ha, ok good :)
http://archive.getdeb.net/install_deb/playdeb_0.3-1~getdeb1_all.deb
Thank you for your help, even if the problem did seem to clear up on its own.
sure :)
Could you explain to me how to add software sources manually, in case it ever comes up again?
ikonia is right you should not do that.  (if you did want to do it anyway you'd use sudo)
I haven't used a command prompt since MS-DOS. Something tells me I am in for a bit of a learning curve on this one.
No, mac runs on a different kernel so the binaries won't work (that's the biggest of many reasons)
